hanzi-su-wiki:
剣

Значения

Меч

Мнемоника

Слева — человек 人, рот 口, а также треугольник — символ единства в значении собираться вместе и горланить, «сообща». Обоюдоострый меч 刂, способный поразить всех врагов.

Варианты

劍, 剑, 劔, 劒, 剱, 釼

heisig_story: Awl . . . saber. As we promised way back in frame 87, here at last is the kanji on which the primitive element of the same name is based.
koohiiStory1: If it helps, make the awl primitive ice pick instead. They´re basically the same thing. This kanji is an easy David vs. Goliath story of the icepick vs. the saber...
koohiiStory2: Every self-respecting ninja knows the story of "The Awl and the Sabre". According to the legend, a woman once defended herself by using an awl against a sabre! She used to work all day with that awl. However, the bandit using the sabre had no skill. And thus the awl beat the sabre. And from there the saying goes : "The sabre is powerless against the awl, if one can´t use the sabre.".

Radicals: 刂  (knife, squid)
Meaning Mnemonic
Tie a squid to a knife and you get a sword! Knives are too small to be considered a sword on their own. That's why you strapped a squid to it. They're the right shape, kinda pointed, so no one will know it's just a knife.
Imagine creating your own sword out of a knife and a squid.
Reading Mnemonic
You learned how to make swords this way from Ken (けん) the samurai. He put his own little squid buddy on his knife and now no one realizes it's not a sword!
Picture Ken swinging his squid sword at you. *Squish* it squirts ink on your shoulder. But it doesn't really hurt.
